channel.title: Random thing I was working on
channel.description:
*Updated version* [IMG]http://i666.photobucket.com/albums/vv23/uberxgod/MP_VineEdition2.jpg[/img]
The picture pretty much says it all, [IMG]http://i666.photobucket.com/albums/vv23/uberxgod/MP.jpg[/img]

item.title: Random thing I was working on
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

man_killerx:

I have really been messing around with the theme of this layout, Currently I have one that is based around the vines. Becuause that is what catches my eye the most. I would love to make a open community game project, But I would have to speak to some of the coders/Mopar admins first. To see first, If we are allowed to use the title “Mopar” and second if they want to use a existing game engine (unity or unreal). Or if they just want to build one from scratch.

Why keep the Mopar name if the project is going to based in unity or unreal, therefore probably nothing to do with runescape?

Read full topic

item.source: Random thing I was working on

item.title: Random thing I was working on
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:5, topic:422112”]is it me or are you constantly “working on something”?

you post like one picture of it and like never update it and later on you post a picture of a completely different genre

like you said you were working on that samurai armor for a game and earler than that you had made garbage bags and a gumpster for a game, each of which you said like “for this game ive been working on”, what ever happened to these games?

im not calling you out or anything it just seems weird to me[/quote]
Obviously the samurai gets jumped at a dumpster. Only plausible explanation.

And actual modelers tend to only spend 2 hours max on a project at a time, or else you will want to blow your brains out in the end. Or get bored of the model and never return to it. Seen many people suggest having 2 or 3 projects models that you are working on that way you don’t get bored with one and never finish it.

Read full topic
